FuncDef:
The srv6-te-policy threshold-alarm command configures upper and lower thresholds for the number of SRv6 TE Policy-related resources.
The undo srv6-te-policy threshold-alarm command restores the default upper and lower thresholds for the number of SRv6 TE Policy-related resources.
By default, the upper limit of the threshold is 80% and the lower limit is 75%.
CLIs: undo srv6-te-policy group-number threshold-alarm [ upper-limit <upperLimitValue> lower-limit <lowerLimitValue> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Set the upper-limit value (the default value is 75).
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 99, in percentage.

Specifies to set the threshold number of SRv6 TE Policy.
-

Set the upper-limit value (the default value is 80).
The value is an integer that ranges from 2 to 100, in percentage.

Specifies to set the threshold number of SRv6 TE Policy group.
-

Specifies to set the threshold number of Segment List.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The command is used to configure upper and lower thresholds for the number of SRv6 TE Policy-related resources. By default, the upper limit of the threshold is 80% and the lower limit is 75%.
